summary.subject: CfP - 2nd International Conference on Engineering Digital Twins
summary.event: 2nd International Conference on Engineering Digital Twins (EDTconf 2025)
summary.scope: The conference aims to bring together researchers and practitioners from academia and industry to improve the systematic and scalable engineering of Digital Twins across various domains including agriculture, automotive, healthcare, and smart cities.
topics_of_interest: Modeling concepts and languages for developing DTs
AI for DTs and DTs for AI
DevOps for DTs and DTs for DevOps
Quality assurance and evaluation of DTs
Models, simulation, and co-simulation of CPS
Model consistency and evolution of DT models
Dynamic reconfiguration and optimization of DTs
Reliability, trust, and security of DTs
Continuous learning and improvement with DTs
Combining models and data in DTs
Case studies and empirical studies of DT development

submission_guidelines.regular_papers: Max 10+2 pages for novel research contributions.
submission_guidelines.exemplar_papers: Max 6+1 pages focused on engineering DTs.

summary.publication_opportunity: Authors of selected regular papers will be invited to submit extended versions to the Journal on Software and Systems Modeling (SoSyM), with new material required.

co_chairs: Manuel Wimmer (Johannes Kepler University Linz, AT)
